intro: Jaramilloa hylibates, commonly known as the slender jaramilloa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
